intro: Kuepferia infelix, commonly known as the sorrowful kuepferia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial shade. Its foliage is dark green and lance-shaped, adding a dramatic visual contrast to its vibrant blooms. Kuepferia infelix is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
